definition: to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first

sentences.english: You don't know when to write off a loss.
sentences.chinese: 你不知道什么时候该认栽。

definition: to be forced to suffer in silence/unable to speak of one's bitter suffering
lit. if you agree to bet you must accept to lose/fig. you bet, you pay
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
pent-up unspoken grievances/suffering not willingly or possibly spoken of
a wise man knows better than to fight when the odds are against him (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 chi1 yan3 qian2 kui1

definition: no choice but to suffer in silence (idiom)/also written 啞巴吃黃蓮|哑巴吃黄莲/(often precedes 有苦說不出|有苦说不出[you3 ku3 shuo1 bu5 chu1])
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
no choice but to suffer in silence (idiom)/also written 啞巴吃黃連|哑巴吃黄连/(often precedes 有苦說不出|有苦说不出[you3 ku3 shuo1 bu5 chu1])
to know that one is in the wrong (idiom)
you got me!/you win!/you are something!
to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
